intro: Xyris almae, commonly known as the Alma's goldenroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Xyridaceae, which includes various species of grass-like plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of yellow flowers in early spring. Xyris almae is typically found in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in wetlands. Its botanical characteristics make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
